items.title: keras TF 2.2 mileading error mesg
items.body:
Got this error mesg - 
 Disabling SMDebug as it does not support eager modefor TF versions 1.x

>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> tf.__version__
‘2.2.0' 

I am using run_eagerly=True in model compile. 

model.compile(
      loss='sparse_categorical_crossentropy',
      optimizer=tf.keras.optimizers.Adam(0.001),
      metrics=['accuracy’], run_eagerly=True
  )

items.title: Name clash when operator is called multiple times during forward pass
items.body:
When running debugger in Resnet model training,  debugger only stores one activation output tensor per basic block, while there should be 2. Here is a code snippet:

```
class BasicBlock(nn.Module):
    
    def __init__():
        super(BasicBlock, self).__init__()

        [...]

        self.conv1 = conv3x3(inplanes, planes, stride)
        self.bn1 = norm_layer(planes)
        self.relu = nn.ReLU(inplace=True)
        self.conv2 = conv3x3(planes, planes)
        self.bn2 = norm_layer(planes)

    def forward(self, x):
        out = self.conv1(x)
        out = self.bn1(out)
        out = self.relu(out)

        out = self.conv2(out)
        out = self.bn2(out)
        out = self.relu(out)

        return out
```

`self.relu` is called twice but only last one will be stored by debugger. This happens because both tensors have the same name. I avoided this problem by customizing the hook and [keeping track of tensor names](https://github.com/NRauschmayr/amazon-sagemaker-examples/blob/update_iterative_model_pruning/sagemaker-debugger/pytorch_iterative_model_pruning/src/custom_hook.py#L20) during forward pass. While this works, it is not the nicest solution. Is there another workaround?

items.title: Crash occurs when trying to register a hook on a tensor that doesn't require gradients
items.body:
**Background**: I am trying to run a SageMaker Training Job with custom PyTorch 1.4.0 code using the official sagemaker-pytorch-container (763104351884.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/pytorch-training:1.4.0-gpu-py36-cu101-ubuntu16.04) on a single ml.p3.2xlarge instance.

**Issue**: I get the following error: `RuntimeError: cannot register a hook on a tensor that doesn't require gradient`. Issue is related to the fact that, in my code, I'm loading a previously trained `torch.nn.Embedding` that does not need gradient updates. Disabling SageMaker Debugger by passing `debugger_hook_config=False` to the Estimator constructor gets past the error, but then training hangs indefinitely after the first training step.

items.title: Request to store static trial dataset on smdebug-testing/resources
items.body:
I want to store a static trial dataset containing 20 steps written by 3 workers, i.e 60 total steps, to improve the speed of the test.

The dataset is currently available for download [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ)

items.title: tensor_names() when passed a step returns names of reductions instead of tensors
items.body: tr.tensor_names(0) returns something like smdebug/reductions/max/tensorname. It should only be returning tensorname. This is happening because the tensorname is being inserted into mode_to_tensors_map like that. Maybe global_step_to_tensors_map also needs to be looked at.

items.title: Move save_scalar framework test to framework folder
items.body: Please move the framework dependent tests to the respective framework folder, so that DLC can run the appropriate pytest tests/framework, pytest tests/core, pytest tests/analysis

items.title: Cannot install it via pip-tools
items.body:
Hi,

I'm trying to use pip-tools to install the package. the configuration I want is:

```
numpy==1.14.6
mxnet==1.4.1
boto3==1.10.32
stepfunctions==1.0.0.1
pur==5.2.2
sagemaker-experiments==0.1.2
smdebug==0.4.14
```

However I get thrown:

```
Finding the best candidates:
  found candidate aioboto3==6.4.1 (constraint was ==6.4.1)
Could not find a version that matches aiobotocore==0.11.0,~=0.10.2
Tried: 0.0.5, 0.0.6, 0.1.1, 0.2.0, 0.2.1, 0.2.1, 0.2.2, 0.2.2, 0.2.3, 0.2.3, 0.3.0, 0.3.0, 0.3.1, 0.3.1, 0.3.2, 0.3.2, 0.3.3, 0.3.3, 0.4.0, 0.4.0, 0.4.1, 0.4.1, 0.4.2, 0.4.2, 0.4.3, 0.4.3, 0.4.4, 0.4.4, 0.4.5, 0.4.5, 0.5.0, 0.5.0, 0.5.1, 0.5.1, 0.5.2, 0.5.2, 0.5.3, 0.5.3, 0.6.0, 0.6.0, 0.7.0, 0.7.0, 0.8.0, 0.8.0, 0.9.0, 0.9.1, 0.9.1, 0.9.2, 0.9.2, 0.9.3, 0.9.3, 0.9.4, 0.9.4, 0.10.0, 0.10.0, 0.10.1, 0.10.1, 0.10.2, 0.10.2, 0.10.3, 0.10.3, 0.10.4, 0.10.4, 0.11.0, 0.11.0
Skipped pre-versions: 0.6.1a0, 0.6.1a0
There are incompatible versions in the resolved dependencies.
```

I would think that my requirements file is fairly basic. Is this something you can help with?

items.title: Allow setting of global mode
items.body: Right now only train eval and predict can be set. This causes some problems for xgboost in rules as they have no mode

items.title: Doc updates
items.body:
- [x] Hook: 'main interface to use training'
- [x] Glossary missing - "**Glossary is in api.md**"
- [x] Some links broken 
- [x] Rule : A condition that will trigger an exception and terminate the training job early. Doesn't have to do that
- [x] Hook from SageMaker?
- [x] Api.md has SageMaker Zero-Code-Change vs. Python API, which is not on the page
- [x] Built in rules table is broken
- [x] Homepage: If a rule is triggered, it will raise a CloudWatch event and stop the training job, -> Incorrect
- [x] Distributed training
- [x] A section on keras (non tf.keras)
- [x] Beef up PT and MXNet pages to be as good as TF
- [x] Complete XGBoost docs (Edward)
- [x] Link to analysis docs in main README

items.title: Fix bug in tensor.values method
items.body: mode is not passed to steps() method

items.title: Watch for collection files as well as training_job_end
items.body: On trial start, don't block on collections which might never come. Also keep watch for training_job_end file

items.title: Duplicate debug logs when saving scalar
items.body: One in log_save and other in write_scalar. We should address this

items.title: PyTorch ResNet50 not saving any collections or tensors
items.body:
https://github.com/rondogency/smdebug-benchmark/blob/master/pt/pt_res50_cifar10.py

is failing on Python 3.6 with PyTorch 1.3.1 and smdebug 0.4.7, per Ziyi's perf tests.

I have verified that it saves weights and gradients correctly if I pass --save_more, but it does not save losses in either case. Running with ZCC causes it to work, which means that the issue is likely in `save_scalar()` (because ZCC is still using the old `record_tensor_value` function). Adding @vandanavk to resolve.

items.title: `python -m smdebug.rules.invoke_rule` fails
items.body:
For example,

`python -m smdebug.rules.rule_invoker --trial-dir ~/ts_outputs/vanishing_gradients --rule-name VanishingGradient --threshold 0.0000000001`


This fails because there's no __main__ function, and it leads to a double-import where smdebug.rules has an __init__.py which imports invoke_rule.

items.title: Improve performance of KerasHook
Make keras hook safer by logging error instead of crashing when train_fn, eval_fn are None
items.body: add_callbacks can crash when execution function hasn't been built for whatever reason. Ziyi discovered that before step 0 there is no execution function when using generators, it was built only at step0. So we can only save from step1 in that case.

items.title: Remove dependency on aioboto3
items.body:
Causing too many dependency conflict issues with other packages. It's not worth it. 

Let's migrate to s3transfer or raw boto3
